alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 28 at 1:32PM MST until March 02 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM WEDNESDAY TO 8 AM MST THURSDAY ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow showers tonight will become heavier and more widespread during the day Wednesday and into Wednesday night. Southwest winds of 15 to 25 mph, with gusts from 35 to 45 mph, will create areas of blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Areas above 4000 feet near Doney Park, Flagstaff, Grand Canyon, North Rim, Sedona, Valle and Williams. * WHEN...From 5 AM Wednesday to 8 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Snow forecast from 5 AM Wednesday to 8 AM Thursday: Doney Park 9 to 13 inches Flagstaff 14 to 20 inches Grand Canyon 7 to 11 inches North Rim 10 to 16 inches Sedona 4 to 6 inches Valle 4 to 8 inches Williams 11 to 17 inches.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Western Mogollon Rim
